1121086973253275649.text: If you’re on the verge of quitting something, I hope it is not bc you feel like you don’t belong. By all means quit the toxic job, the boring job, but you can still win. It’s not over yet.

1121086972515086341.text: ...if I did, I would have missed out on all the cool features I’ve shipped at Adobe, speaking at the keynote and other fun events, travel to a dozen cities, financial stability/insurance, friendships with tons of great humans and generally feeling happy and well.

1121086971739160577.text: 2: because someone out there probably needs to hear this. I was transcribing because I was considering quitting design, felt like I was lousy at it and didn’t have a future in it. My esteem was so low that ~1/90ing my rate seemed realistic.

1121086971080609792.text: 1: the worst transcriptions are literal. They include ‘um’ ‘ah’ and false starts where people begin a thought before they find what they really want to say. Truth isn’t literal. As a designer/writer/researcher/transcriber you have to parse what’s there to make meaning.

1121086970304716801.text: In 2015, I moonlit as a transcriber for about ~$3/hr. It taught me enough that I get annoyed when I see bad transcriptions of audio files. Two very lessons from that time:

1099464465160884224.text: Hot on the heels of my last tweet, any of you use @blot__ it looks too good to be true?

1099444163202867200.text: It's been a long time since I published on @Medium. Everything appears kind of the same, but different. It makes me feel nervous for some reason. Any of you have thoughts/reassurances? Alternative would be starting to use my personal domain for new essays.

1098719664253722624.text: Teams need a shared code of conduct and respect for one another, but they should not be clones. A strong team hires from diverse backgrounds and experiences (yes I’m talking explicitly about capital D Diversity), and different team members have different strengths.

1098719663066775552.text: Have a nervous disposition? Oh, I hear you’re good at edge cases and helping the team really consider what they’re launching. Like to think with words/pics instead of in real time? I hear you’re super good at communicating ideas asynchronously.

951880127792607232.text: 4) I use 'they' as a gender neutral pronoun. It's fine. Everyone will know what you're talking about.

951879886662021120.text: 3) if I'm meeting someone with a name I don't know how to pronounce, I just Google it. Often if it's a common name in another country, someone's made a pronunciation guide.

951879546600546304.text: 2) no 'guys'. I still say it once in a while and it's not necessarily offensive, but if I am not a guy, you can't call a group I'm in 'guys'. There are other more inclusive terms.
